newsitem.title: USA: Rainbow sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Rainbow sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Rainbow Technologies Inc said Tuesday it adopted a shareholder's rights plan with a 15 percent trigger.
Rainbow said it did not adopt the rights plan in response to any effort to acquire control of the company.
The board declared a dividend of one purchase right for each share of its common stock outstanding to stockholders of record on August 5.
Under the plan, Rainbow will issue one right for each outstanding share of its common stock to the shareholders of record of August 5.
The rights will become exercisable only if a person or group acquires 15 percent or more of Rainbow's outstanding common stock.
Each right will entitle the holder to buy one one-thousandth of a share of common stock, at an exercise price of $90.

Rainbow said it will be entitled to redeem the rights at $0.01 per right at any time before the 10th day following acquisition by a person or group of 15 percent or more of its common stock. The rights will expire on Aug. 5, 2002.
